customData.content: 44-year-old male presented with right-sided chest pain, dry cough, on-off fever, and hematuria for 2 months. Decreased air entry on the right side of the lung was noted during physical examination. The patient has a history of tobacco chewing for >20 years and no history of Antitubercular treatment (ATT) intake.

HPI.summary: right-sided chest pain, dry cough, on-off fever, and hematuria

findings: Decreased air entry on the right side of the lung

customData.content: Contrast-enhanced computed tomography (CECT) thorax revealed a heterogeneous lesion in the mediastinal region abutting the horizontal fissure and cavitation within. Chest lesion associated with multiple centrilobular nodules arranged in a linear branching pattern.

imaging.finding: Heterogeneous lesion abutting the horizontal fissure and cavitation within
Multiple centrilobular nodules arranged in a linear branching pattern

customData.content: Bronchoscopy with bronchoscopic-guided biopsy and Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) was performed. BAL fluid sample was negative for malignant cells. Biopsy sample was suggestive of squamous cell carcinoma.

Patient had complaints of decreased and blurring of vision, ophthalmology opinion was within normal limits. 18F-FDG PET/CT scan revealed a FDG-avid well-defined soft tissue primary mass measuring 5.6 cm x 7.7 cm x 8.3 cm in size with spiculated margins in the upper lobe of the right lung with collapse and consolidation of right lung. Also, FDG avid metastases to mediastinal, abdominopelvic lymph nodes and right-sided pleural deposits with multiple sub-centimetric to centimetric-sized bilateral lung nodules were noted. It was associated with multiple FDG avid brain lesions involving the bilateral cerebral cortex, cerebellum and pituitary. FDG avid bilateral hypodense few (3 in number) soft tissue density bilateral renal masses (largest measuring 2.8 cm x 2.6 cm). Multiple lytic skeletal lesions, few of them with soft tissue component involvement. FDG-avid ill-defined soft tissue mass lesion in the upper lobe of the right lung measuring 5.6 cm × 7.7 cm × 8.3 cm in size, involving mediastinum and associated with atelectatic changes. FDG-avid hypodense lesion in bilateral kidney largest measuring 2.8 cm × 2.6 cm with conglomerated abdominal lymph nodes. Multiple variable sized pleural based soft tissue deposits and lytic skeletal lesion in lumbar vertebrae. 18F-FDG-PET/CT showed FDG-avid right-sided lung mass, abdominal lymph node, multiple focal renal lesions, and multiple FDG-avid skeletal lesions. Also showed FDG-avid soft tissue lesion in the pituitary and a peripheral enhancing hypodense soft tissue lesion in the left cerebral hemisphere. Right parietal-occipital bone lytic lesion with soft tissue component involvement. Patient presented with severe headaches and blurring of vision for 15 days. Biopsy results confirmed metastatic involvement. Metabolically active soft tissue lesions were noted involving bilateral kidneys with extensive metastasis as seen in the FDG PET/CT scan.

imaging.impression: primary mass in the upper lobe of the right lung

data.content: Patient underwent imaging to further investigate the cause of his symptoms.
Based on imaging results, bronchoscopy with biopsy and BAL was performed to obtain tissue samples for diagnosis.
Patient developed new neurological symptoms, and further imaging was performed to assess the extent of the disease.
